par.text: Krypton is a colourless, odourless noble gas, slightly soluble in water. It is quite inert. Its atoms do not combine into diatomic molecules. Under specific conditions (electrical discharges, low temperature), krypton (II) fluoride
has been obtained. Krypton was discovered by the British chemists William Ramsay and Morris Travers during the distillation of noble gases. Its name is derived from the Greek
